headline: The U.S. Wants to Test Nukes. What That Means for Defense Stocks.
summary: President Donald Trump wants the Department of Defense to start testing nuclear weapons again, something America hasn’t done since 1992.  For now, investors want to know what it could mean for defense stocks.  The short answer is not much—though they might want to brush up on America’s nuclear capabilities.

headline: Why Boeing (BA) Stock Is Falling Today
summary: Shares of aerospace and defense company Boeing (NYSE:BA) fell 4.6% in the morning session after the company reported a significant third-quarter loss driven by a nearly $5 billion charge related to another delay in its 777X jet program. The planemaker posted a net loss of over $5.3 billion, with the loss per share coming in much deeper than analysts expected. headline: The Dow Is Losing Steam. Why It's Still Leading the S&P 500 and Nasdaq.
summary: The Dow lost steam on Thursday after the blue-chip index neared its highest levels on record.  The S&P 500 was down 0.4%, while the Nasdaq Composite was down 0.9%.  The S&P was down even though 340 stocks in the index were set to close higher.

headline: Boeing stock looks fully valued despite long-term progress, Deutsche Bank says
summary: Investing.com -- Deutsche Bank downgraded Boeing Co to Hold from Buy, saying the stock’s valuation has caught up with its long-term recovery prospects and that “there’s a lot of wood to chop to get there.”

headline: Google vs. Meta, Boeing-Airbus, Chipotle: Trending Stocks
summary: Why did Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) soar while Meta (META) plummeted in premarket, in the wake of respective earnings reports? In aviation, the divide between Boeing (BA) and Airbus (AIR.PA) deepens, with the American plane maker's stock sliding - while its European rival rallies. Chipotle (CMG) tanks nearly 19% in premarket, along with other restaurant chains (CAVA, WING, SHAK) also in the red. In semiconductors, Samsung (005930.KS) and Nvidia (NVDA) are trending. For more live coverage of markets watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.

headline: BA Q3 Deep Dive: 777X Delay Clouds Rapid Commercial Recovery and Strong Demand
summary: Aerospace and defense company Boeing (NYSE:BA) reported revenue ahead of Wall Streets expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 30.4% year on year to $23.27 billion. Its non-GAAP loss of $7.35 per share was significantly below analysts’ consensus estimates.
